meanings.definition: In a deceitful or fraudulent manner
meanings.sent1: He acted dishonestly by cheating on the test.
meanings.sent2: She was caught behaving dishonestly by stealing money from the company.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed his tricks dishonestly, fooling the audience.
meanings.sent4: The politician spoke dishonestly, promising things he knew he couldn't deliver.
meanings.sent5: The student looked around dishonestly before copying the answers.

meanings.sent1: The dishonestly written report misled many people.
meanings.sent2: Her dishonestly crafted excuse did not fool anyone.
meanings.sent3: The dishonestly made cake tasted terrible, as if something was missing.
meanings.sent4: The dishonestly built house collapsed after just a few months.
meanings.sent5: His dishonestly earned reputation quickly caught up with him.
